instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPUâ€™s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light Fan Spin, no POST .800mAmp
threads.message:
Hi, I have this board and has every single power rail on page 7 but <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>. Reprogramed the BIOS still no change
I have all the voltages for the board to work, but it just doesn't.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> = 3.3
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 1.1

amperage going up from 800 mAmp to 1.2 Amp 

death CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green Light Fan Spin, no POST .800mAmp
threads.message:
How many times we discussed about iGPU voltage on the forum???
And people still search for it on boot  :(.

VCORE stuck at 1.1V means board doesn't boot, just stays on; it should drop to 0.75V when boots.

Any history available?
Did you test various DDR3 modules, one at a time?
